conclusion: Shadows are formed when an object blocks light; shape and size depend on positions of light source, object, and surface.
Closer light source makes shadows larger and more diffuse; farther light source makes shadows smaller and sharper.
Light source casts shadows A, B, C, and D, which are large and diffuse.
Moving light source forward will make shadows move backward and become larger.
Shadow A will move backward and become larger.
Shadow B will move backward and become larger.
Shadow C will move backward and become larger.
Shadow D will move backward and become larger.
Final answer: Shadows A, B, C, and D will move backward and become larger.
